result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

1:07 PM Defendant ROBERT G HILLS appeared by video, in custody.  Atty Michael Kapelis appears for the defendant via zoom. Attorney Matthew Steven McElroy in court for State of Wisconsin. Defendant has no objection to holding this hearing via zoom. Atty Kapelis has not received a copy of the criminal complaint. Defendant has received a copy of the criminal complaint. Atty Kapelis waives reading. Court instructs the defendant of the maximum penalty on each count. ADA makes bond recommendation. Court sets bond at $500.00 cash bond and conditions of: Defendant is to maintain absolute sobriety - not to possess or consume any alcohol, illegal drugs or prescription drugs without a valid prescription.  You may be randomly tested for compliance.  Take all medications as prescribed. Defendant is not to possess any dangerous weapons including firearms.
